citation.article-title: The phylogeny of acetic acid bacteria based on the partial sequences of 16S ribosomal RNA: the elevation of the subgenus Gluconoacetobacter to the generic level.

p.s: Gluconoacetobacter (Glu.con.o.a.ce.to.bac'ter: M.L.n. acidum gluconicum gluconic acid; Ln. acetum vinegar; M.L.n. bacter masculine equivalent of Gr.neut.n. bacterion rod; M.L.masc.n. Gluconoacetobacter gluconate-vinegar rod)
Gram-negative rods. occurring singly, in pairs, in chains or in small clusters.
Glossy. smooth and entire or pellicle-forming colonies are formed.
Oxidizes mostly lactate and acetate to carbon dioxide and water.
Acids are formed from glucose, mannose, xylose and ethanol.
Produces mostly 5-ketogluconate and 2-ketogluconate from glucose and dihydroxyacetone from glycerol.
Cellular fatty acid is straight chain type containing C18:1 acid as major and C 16:0 in coexistence of very small amount of C14:0.
DNA base composition ranges 54.9 to 66.411101% guanine plus cytosine.
